page.title: 12WEST MERSEA ROMAN TOMB.
page.content: West Mersea's most famous Relic is the Barrow which stands near to the Strood. Originally 60 feet in diameter, this mound enlosed a burial, which was Excavated by the Essex Archaeological Society in 1912.They found a vault of red brick, enclosing a lead casket measuring about two cubic feet.This casket contained a fine glass bowl,in which were the cremated remains of an adult. These relics are now in Colchester Museum. The superior quality of the urn,together with the vastness of the Barrow,indicates that the person buried there was someone of considerable wealth and standing.
